intro: Nototriche calchaquensis, commonly known as the Andean bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Andes mountains of South America. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in high-altitude grasslands and rocky areas, thriving in cool, moist conditions. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, often covered in a fine layer of white hair. Nototriche calchaquensis plays an important role in its ecosystem, providing nectar for pollinators and contributing to the biodiversity of its native habitat.
